description: To support the ministry and get access to exclusive content, go to: http://patreon.com/logicalbiblestudy  John 5: 1-3, 5-16 - 'The healing at the pool of Bethesda.'  Catechism of the Catholic Church Paragraphs: - 583 (in 'Jesus and the temple') - He went there each year during his hidden life at least for Passover. His public ministry itself was patterned by his pilgrimages to Jerusalem for the great Jewish feasts (abbreviated). - 575 (in 'Jesus and Israel') - Many of Jesus' deeds and words constituted a "sign of contradiction", but more so for the religious authorities in Jerusalem, whom the Gospel according to John often calls simply "the Jews", than for the ordinary People of God (abbreviated).  Got a Bible question? Send an email to logicalbiblestudy@gmail.com, and it will be answered in an upcoming episode!  ---   Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/daily-gospel-exegesis/message
html_description:
To support the ministry and get access to exclusive content, go to: http://patreon.com/logicalbiblestudy




John 5: 1-3, 5-16 - 'The healing at the pool of Bethesda.'




Catechism of the Catholic Church Paragraphs:


- 583 (in 'Jesus and the temple') - He went there each year during his hidden life at least for Passover. His public ministry itself was patterned by his pilgrimages to Jerusalem for the great Jewish feasts (abbreviated).


- 575 (in 'Jesus and Israel') - Many of Jesus' deeds and words constituted a "sign of contradiction", but more so for the religious authorities in Jerusalem, whom the Gospel according to John often calls simply "the Jews", than for the ordinary People of God (abbreviated).




Got a Bible question? Send an email to logicalbiblestudy@gmail.com, and it will be answered in an upcoming episode!


---
Send in a voice message: https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/daily-gospel-exegesis/message
name: Tuesday of Week 4 of Lent - John 5: 1-3, 5-16
